column4: Hi,how would from the start gui programs, initiate a shared hard disk drive?
which would be the command to be inserted in the startup programs gui for it?
for a shared hard disk drive?
Hi,how would from the start gui programs, initiate a shared hard disk drive?
which would be the command to be inserted in the startup programs gui for it?
you want a hd mounted on booting?
i have windows , ubuntu 11.04 and ubuntu 10.04 and i want this hd mounted when i startup my ubuntu 11.04
ok but which is the comand to insert  in the start gui programs?
you don't do it that way if you want partiions mounted it is fstab.
ok from the  start gui programs i will search the site or comand to do it
search /etc/fstab from start gui programs ?
I think you don't understand startup applications has nothing to do with having partitions mounted on the computer automatically it is a fstab job
ok i dont understand but i will to try from start gui programs , search /etc/fstab, because is easier for me
what is start gui programs?
if you want startup with compiz you must have compiz in the startup gui programs of ubntu
is only a example
it is startup applications no gui in there, what you want is a partition mounted correct?
ok of course
great that is done by adding the correct lines in fstab, not the startup manager we can help you here if we are on the same page.
startup applications manager thatbs.
whats thatbs?
ok was an error but i wanted the comand to insert in the gui
it doesn't work that way I give up good luck./
ok another time will be....
